description: The Irish government has decided not to move to Phase 4 of its Covid-19 recovery plan, due on 10 August.
title: Coronavirus: Republic of Ireland's pubs to stay closed
title_page: Coronavirus: Republic of Ireland's pubs to stay closed - BBC News
maintext: In Northern Ireland, "wet pubs" - or pubs that do not serve food - have been given an indicative date to reopen from Monday 10 August, but this has yet to be signed off by the Stormont Executive.
